Activity: Log in, check emails. Respond to urgent requests. Have a cup of coffee.

Meet with @clinlead-1 (Clinical Lead) to discuss clinical requirements for influenza data collection. Understand the specific data points needed for effective influenza surveillance and patient management.
Refine the gap analysis document based on feedback from the clinical lead. Update the list of required data fields and workflow modifications.
Begin planning potential EHR system updates/modifications based on the gap analysis. Explore options for creating new data fields, customizing existing workflows, and implementing validation rules.

Contact @ehrv-1 (EHR Vendor Liaison) to inquire about available customization options and potential limitations within the EHR system. Topic: 'EHR Customization Options for Influenza Data Collection'.
Lunch Break - Head to the park for a quick walk to clear my head.
Continue planning EHR system updates. Focus on developing a detailed plan for creating new data fields related to influenza symptoms, vaccination dates, and diagnosis codes.
Outline the steps involved in customizing existing workflows to ensure accurate and complete influenza data capture. Consider incorporating prompts and alerts to guide users.
Research and document potential validation rules to ensure data quality and consistency. Plan to implement checks for data type, format, and required fields.
Document the proposed EHR system updates/modifications. Create a preliminary design document outlining the new data fields, workflow customizations, and validation rules.
Review tasks and plan for tomorrow. Check email and respond to urgent requests.
